summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Board of Adjustment of the City of Dallas will hold a special meeting on September 17, 2024, at 9:00 A.M. in the Council Chambers at Dallas City Hall, with a videoconference option available. The purpose of the meeting is to address specific permitting issues and discuss the consolidation of related cases.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Call to Order by Chairman David A. Neumann.
2. Public Testimony segment for community input.
3. Discussion on consolidating cases into a single panel for public hearings related to permitting issues in PD 67, Elm Thicket/Northpark, occurring between October 12, 2022, and August 31, 2024.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will focus on the procedural aspects of handling multiple cases that have arisen from permitting issues in a specific district. This consolidation aims to streamline discussions and decisions regarding these cases. The Board is expected to evaluate the implications of this approach on future hearings.

**Action Items**:  
The Board of Adjustment will seek approval for the proposed consolidation of cases into a single panel format. Additionally, public testimony will be taken to gather community perspectives on the matter before any decisions are made. Participants wishing to speak must register by the close of business on September 16, 2024.
